2026-01-07

Open Standalone Page

Chromium Digest: 2026-01-07

Overview

This summary covers 481 relevant commits out of a total of 660 on the main branch for January 7th, 2026. The changes span from the first commit (97aafea) to the last (9576ad7). This digest focuses on significant updates for developers, including several breaking changes to core components, APIs, and UI interfaces, alongside ongoing code modernization efforts.

Breaking Changes

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The entire //ui/gfx/ipc/skia component, including the public header gfx_skia_param_traits.h, has been removed. This component provided IPC serialization for Skia data types. Embedders relying on this for custom IPC must find an alternative serialization method. (6ef8408)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The public data structure WebHistoryService::QueryHistoryResult has been modified. The nested Event struct was removed, and its visits vector has been flattened into the parent QueryHistoryResult struct. Code that consumes results from WebHistoryService will break and must be updated to handle the new flattened structure. (0ec1353)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING Several public callback type aliases in net/base have been removed. Code using net::Int64CompletionRepeatingCallback, net::CancelableCompletionOnceCallback, or net::CancelableCompletionRepeatingCallback must be updated to use the underlying base::RepeatingCallback or base::OnceCallback types directly. (4bd48a1) (4522967)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The public virtual method ImmersiveModeController::ShouldHideTopViews() has been removed. Embedders or derived classes that override or call this method for UI layout decisions in fullscreen mode will fail to compile. (ab52736)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The function signature for ExtensionTabUtil::GetGroupById in chrome/browser/extensions/extension_tab_util.h has changed. The output parameter for visual data is now tab_groups::TabGroupVisualData* out_visual_data. Callers must be updated to match the new signature. (4cfda3d)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING Support for PTP (Picture Transfer Protocol) device monitoring on macOS has been removed from the storage_monitor component. The public enum StorageInfo::MAC_IMAGE_CAPTURE has also been removed. Any code relying on this to detect cameras on macOS will no longer function. (8e0605c)

API & Components

  • WebAuthn now supports password-only immediate mediation requests via navigator.credentials.get({mediation: 'immediate', password: true}), enabling a more streamlined password fetch flow. (77ae88a)
  • A new skills component has been added, including a service and factory, to provide a framework for browser-integrated skills. (98f6588)
  • The base::ToVector utility has been enhanced to allow explicitly specifying the destination value type, enabling more flexible type conversions during vector creation. (e19160e)
  • The WebHistoryService has been updated to correctly parse client_id from server responses and now uses a has_more_results boolean instead of checking for a continuation token, simplifying client logic. (abf4c7c) (1006290)
  • The feature flag kSyncPreferencesUseSelectedTypes is now enabled by default, changing how OS-specific preferences are synced to rely on the explicit "OS preferences" sync toggle rather than the broader "Settings" toggle. (441bddc) (e615258)
  • Significant refactoring of memory pressure handling continues, with SpareRenderProcessHostManagerImpl and MemoryPressureListener being migrated to a more modern, stateful notification API. (a9b9a36) (434f388) (ab00edb)

Browser UI & UX

  • When a bookmark sync limit is exceeded, the error message in the profile menu and settings page now includes an action button that opens a relevant help article. (cd2ff22) (a23241c)
  • The "Reset to Default" theme button now correctly clears the kBrowserFollowSystemThemeColors preference, ensuring the browser properly stops following the system theme when reset. (5a53380)
  • A recent change to improve focus restoration on macOS when a window is un-hidden has been reverted due to test failures, restoring the previous behavior. (dfe3c35) (57f4847)
  • An accessibility improvement in Reading Mode now hides the underlying main webpage from both screen readers and keyboard focus when the mode is active. (961e8d6)
  • The Data Sharing WebUI (chrome-untrusted://data-sharing/) is now disabled in incognito mode to prevent crashes. (68f2b19)

Extensions

  • JSON schemas for APIs like runtime and storage were updated to use Promise-based language in their descriptions to better align with modern Manifest V3 development practices. (3eefd48)
  • A bug was fixed where browser.devtools could be undefined even when chrome.devtools was available, ensuring the alias is correctly created. (2afb511)

Networking & Security

  • A potential security vulnerability was addressed by blocking renderers from using FileChooserParams::Mode::kSave. The browser process will now report a bad message if a compromised renderer attempts to use this obsolete mode. (b709f99)
  • The legacy local-network-access permissions policy has been made forward-compatible. If used, it will now imply the newer, more granular local-network and loopback-network permissions, ensuring older configurations do not break. (2e16212)
  • For improved debugging on Windows, new UMA histograms are now recorded when errors occur during TPM-backed cryptographic key operations. (33fdf75)

Policy & Enterprise

  • The ManagedAccountsSigninRestriction, FirstPartySetsEnabled, and FirstPartySetsOverrides enterprise policies have been marked for deprecation. (4928d97) (7467d85)

Code Health & Refactoring

  • Widespread migration from base::Contains() to the C++20 std::ranges::contains() continues across the codebase, including in the content and net modules. (f489b48) (d6b736c) (cada114)
  • Unsafe raw array usage in Windows-specific file utilities and trace logging was fixed by migrating to safer constructs like base::span. (d3ad83f) (060cd76)

2026-01-06

Open Standalone Page

Chromium Digest: 2026-01-06

Overview

This report covers 648 commits from the main branch on January 6th, 2026, with 491 commits identified as relevant to developers building on Chromium. The changes span from the first commit (0673bf1) to the last (08418a1). This summary highlights numerous breaking API changes, significant security hardening on macOS, and ongoing refactoring efforts across the UI and core libraries.

Breaking Changes

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING [macOS] The loading of third-party in-process plugins is now blocked by default for the CHILD_PLUGIN process type. This security enhancement will break embedders on macOS who rely on this mechanism to load binaries not signed with the same Team ID as the main application. The behavior can be temporarily overridden with the kBlockThirdPartyInProcessPlugins feature flag. (c54ef9c)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING [Windows] Support for detecting MTP/PTP devices via the public StorageMonitor component has been completely removed on Windows. This is a major feature removal that will break embedders relying on this functionality for media device interaction. (aef221a)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The public utility function base::ByteSwap has been removed from the base library. Embedders should migrate to using std::byteswap from the C++ standard library. (5869e71)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The signature of the public GPU method FencedAllocatorWrapper::Alloc() has been changed to return a base::span instead of a raw pointer. Code calling this method must be updated to handle the new return type. (de3e9aa)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The by_display_initiator field has been removed from the public downloads.mojom.Data interface as part of a feature cleanup. Clients of this mojom API will need to be updated. (a2891e1)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING Public serializer functions for session storage and local storage (CreateKey, KeyPrefix, etc.) have been made private by removing them from session_storage_leveldb.h and local_storage_leveldb.h. Any external code relying on these functions will break. (23e8879) (dee78ad)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The MemoryPressureListener has been removed from the public API of the compositor's cc::ResourcePool class. Embedders interacting with this part of the compositor API will need to remove usage of the listener. (4470afa)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The public functions RegisterLegacyUsagePrefsForMigration and MigrateLegacyUsagePrefs have been removed from the Optimization Guide's model_execution_prefs.h header as part of a dead code cleanup. (4bd9cc4)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING Strict validation for JSON MIME types is now unconditional, as the StrictJsonMimeTypeTokenValidation feature flag has been removed. This behavioral change may break integrations that relied on the previous, more lenient parsing of JSON responses. (24b17ed)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The interaction model for tab group headers is now standardized. Left-clicking a header will always toggle its collapsed state, and right-clicking will open the editor bubble. The kLeftClickOpensTabGroupBubble feature flag that allowed customization of this behavior has been removed. (5c3a14f)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING A recent change to the public Cronet networking library has been reverted, removing the was_proxied field from the UrlResponseInfoImpl class. Embedders who adopted this new field will encounter build failures. (cb48ee6)

Security & Privacy

  • The URLAllowlist and URLBlocklist policies were refactored to use the standard sensitive policy mechanism. This improves their visibility on chrome://policy when blocked by an untrusted source, preventing them from being silently ignored. (adfc6d7)
  • Development continues on the experimental Device Bound Session Credentials (DBSC) feature. Changes include adding more detailed event structures to the mojo API for debugging, adding DevTools support behind a flag, and preparing an observer skeleton for the SessionService. (a8949e5) (fd181eb) (3e54720)
  • Internal state tracking for ChildProcessSecurityPolicy was refactored into a new SecurityStateMaps inner class to improve correctness without altering the public API. (589551b)

Browser & UI

  • Public APIs related to an experimental vertical button layout in dialogs have been removed. The allow_vertical_buttons property and its associated methods are no longer available in views::DialogDelegate. (dd407f7)
  • On macOS, a bug was fixed to ensure content areas correctly regain focus when a window is restored from a minimized or hidden state. (7e252e2)
  • On Windows, drag-and-drop functionality was improved to correctly handle dragging multiple files from compressed ZIP folders. (53a893f)
  • A bug causing ampersands (&) to be rendered incorrectly in the "open all" menu items for bookmark folders has been fixed. (249828d)
  • The profile sign-out confirmation dialog was updated to introduce a distinct "Cancel" button, improving the user flow, especially when re-authentication is required. (0508ff4)
  • A large-scale refactoring converted the LayoutConstant enum to an enum class, improving type safety across numerous UI files. (3efff9e) (a303cad) (6c1d3d1)

Extensions

  • The UnpackedInstaller class was moved from chrome/browser/extensions to the more generic extensions/browser directory. This refactoring makes the class more accessible to non-Chrome embedders who need to install unpacked extensions. (e87a1a6)
  • A bug was fixed in the chrome.developerPrivate API that incorrectly fired uninstall events for Theme extensions, which could cause assertion errors. (c12220c)
  • Documentation for several Extension APIs was updated in .idl and .webidl files to use Promise-based language. This change improves documentation and tooling alignment with modern JavaScript but does not alter runtime behavior. (f5b1a2e) (678b098)

Base & Core Internals

  • The base::MemoryPressureListener has been updated to be more stateful. New listeners are now immediately notified of the current memory pressure level upon creation, rather than waiting for the next pressure change. (5c71b78)
  • A new stub module, activity_reporter, has been created and is owned by the BrowserProcess. This aims to centralize activity logging for metrics in the future. (c75e058)
  • The Windows updater was improved to delete orphaned version directories during cleanup and to try uninstalling for a longer duration to increase success rates. (79ec113)
  • Widespread code modernization continues, with many instances of base::Contains() being replaced by std::ranges::contains() and raw pointer/size pairs being replaced with base::span. (e13cb6a) (f301383) (116ad4d)

Feature Lifecycle & Cleanup

  • The feature flag kUserAgentFrozenBuildVersion and its associated parameter have been removed from embedder_support. This solidifies the "0" build number in the User-Agent string and removes a configuration point for embedders. (efdbfb2)
  • The feature flag enable-secure-payment-confirmation-availability-api was removed now that the API is fully launched. (3551439)
  • Obsolete code for cleaning up the PNaCl component was removed from the component updater, as PNaCl itself was removed over six months ago. (99a92f9)
  • The "Read Aloud" feature flag was removed from chrome://flags as the feature moves towards launch. (d52447d)

Build & Testing

  • [Revert] A change that enabled asynchronous hit testing for drag-and-drop operations on macOS was reverted due to a crash regression. This temporarily disables improved drag-and-drop support for out-of-process iframes on Mac. (e7ef7cd)
  • The build system's process for handling sensitive policies has been automated. The build now automatically adds required notices, with a presubmit check to prevent manual additions. (2f59496)
  • The Node.js dependency used for various build tools has been updated to v24.12.0 LTS. (8ced542)

2026-01-05

Open Standalone Page

Chromium Digest: 2026-01-05

Overview

This summary covers 378 relevant commits out of a total of 552 on the main branch. The day's changes span from the first commit (5d4f3a6) to the last (206706e). The day was marked by a large number of breaking changes across core APIs, browser UI management, and media parsers, requiring significant attention from embedders.

APIs & Core Libraries

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING CHANGE: The public method RenderWidgetHost::WillSendInputEventToRenderer has been renamed to SimulateUserInteraction. Embedders using this method from content/public/browser/render_widget_host.h to simulate user input must update their code. (064f6d1)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING CHANGE: The static method MemoryPressureListener::SetNotificationsSuppressed(bool) has been removed from base/memory/memory_pressure_listener.h. It is replaced by a new reference-counted token system using base::MemoryPressureSuppressionToken. Direct calls to the old method will no longer compile. (63f5b8d)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING CHANGE: The method for accessing DefaultBrowserManager has changed. The static getter GlobalFeatures::default_browser_manager() is removed. Clients must now use the DefaultBrowserManager::From(BrowserProcess::g_browser_process) pattern. (f66567c)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING CHANGE: The signature for BrowserTabRestore::Restore in chrome/browser/sessions/browser_tab_restore.h has been changed to accept base::span instead of const std::vector& for its tab entry arguments. (c350cdc)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING CHANGE: The public data structure JpegParseResult in media/parsers/jpeg_parser.h has been modified. The data member is now a base::raw_span, and JpegHuffmanTable uses std::array. Embedders using this media parser directly must update their code. (4f46f03)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING CHANGE: An overload of the Append method that took a (const T* str, size_t str_len) has been removed from the public CanonOutputT template class in url/url_canon.h. Callers must migrate to the std::basic_string_view overload. (9989ff4)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING CHANGE: Legacy IPC parameter traits for several graphics and color space types have been removed. This affects gfx::ColorSpace enums (PrimaryID, TransferID, MatrixID) and Skia structs (skcms_TransferFunction, skcms_Matrix3x3). Embedders passing these types over custom legacy IPC or Mojo interfaces will encounter build failures. (6407f55) (ffd5adf) (b465361)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING CHANGE: A major refactoring of Mojo's public Java bindings will break Java-based embedders. Router::setIncomingMessageReceiver is replaced by setPrimaryStub, Interface.Stub is moved to a top-level Stub class, and SideEffectFreeCloseable is removed. (d635aa9)
  • The supervised user settings service was refined to reduce noisy, empty notifications, improving performance for consumers like the pref store. (ff73427)

Browser & UI

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING CHANGE: Public static methods GetGuestBrowserCount() and IsOffTheRecordBrowserInUse() have been removed from the BrowserList class. Embedders must migrate to the equivalent functions in chrome/browser/ui/browser_finder.h. (83633e5)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING CHANGE: A new pure virtual method, GetAttachedContext(), has been added to the TabDragTarget public interface. Custom implementations of this interface, used for tab dragging UI, must now provide an implementation for this new method. (4eee675)
  • Significant refactoring for the Vertical Tabs feature, including a switch to FlexLayout and decoupling BrowserRootView from specific tabstrip implementations to improve maintainability and support for animations. (4631898) (98134b0) (367944b) (977a559)
  • On macOS, asynchronous hit-testing is now used for drag-and-drop operations to better support out-of-process iframes. (fbc5fa3)
  • The StartupLaunchManager on Windows now defers registry writes until after initialization is complete, reducing intermittent states during browser startup. (16dae73)
  • UI refinements include a fix for popup positioning on macOS for the "Chrome Next" design, a z-index fix for the realbox search component, and making the "Open All" item in bookmark folders non-draggable. (9de43a7) (c2c0669) (e21d4bb)

Security & Policy

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING CHANGE: In the PasskeyUnlockManager::Observer public interface, the pure virtual method OnPasskeyUnlockManagerStateChanged has been renamed to OnPasskeyErrorUiStateChanged. Classes implementing this observer must be updated. (ce7a198)
  • Work continues on Device Bound Session Credentials (DBSC) with the addition of new data structures and a GetAllSessionDisplays method to the SessionService to facilitate debugging via DevTools. (206706e) (51de6db) (c955e8e)
  • The DeveloperToolsPolicyChecker logic was updated. If an allowlist is set and the blocklist is empty, any URL not on the allowlist will now be blocked. (6b0b832)
  • A use-after-free vulnerability in the Bluetooth classic device implementation on macOS was fixed by hardening the disconnect listener. (c34d0e5)
  • For enterprise SSO, a temporary user agent spoof for Okta was reverted, and the allowlist of response headers for the Okta backup flow was expanded to support challenge-based authentication. (aa7bdaa) (694f378)

Extensions

  • A bug was fixed where chrome.tabs.query({currentWindow:true}) would fail for extensions running in the side panel. The ExtensionFunctionDispatcher now uses a SidePanelHelper to get the correct window context. (d8e73fc)
  • A Use-After-Free (UAF) bug in the socket API was fixed by adding null checks in the ScopedWriteQuote destructor, improving stability during shutdown. (1463ae3)
  • The extensions menu view model was updated to correctly observe the active WebContents, fixing a bug where its state would not update on navigation. (21d8ed5)
  • A regression test was added for the chrome.runtime.sendMessage API to prevent hangs when a large number of concurrent messages are sent from different frames. (a8e9382)

Networking

  • The garbage collection logic for token binding keys has been improved to prevent the deletion of valid keys created during the current browser session. New UMA histograms were added to monitor GC efficiency. (e13f01a)

Testing & Build System

  • The build system now officially marks C++23 as supported, and a new GN argument, enable_swift_cxx_interop, was added to control Swift/C++ interop in builds. (bb0a8ce) (d148a90)
  • Multiple instances of unsafe C-style array and buffer usage were fixed across the codebase by migrating to base::span, improving memory safety in areas like Windows crash reporting and remoting. (e39c67e) (426c85b) (284d74c) (9e0e7ee)
  • The feature flag for "starting-style debugging" in DevTools has been removed, enabling the feature by default for all users. (16e6c48)

2026-01-03

Open Standalone Page

Chromium Digest: 2026-01-03

Overview

This digest covers 20 commits from (d5d92a2)" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="text-sky-500 hover:text-sky-300 font-mono">((d5d92a2)) to (ddd4762)" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="text-sky-500 hover:text-sky-300 font-mono">((ddd4762)). After filtering out changes specific to ChromeOS, Blink, and routine translations, 15 commits were analyzed. The key highlight is a breaking change in a Bluetooth test utility, alongside notable updates to Safe Browsing, extensions, and experimental UI features.

APIs & Testing

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING Breaking Change: The pure virtual method PlatformSupportsLowEnergy() has been removed from the device::BluetoothTestBase test utility class. Any downstream test classes inheriting from this base class must remove their implementation of this method to compile. (b64652f)

Security

  • The internal diagnostic method GetSentHitReports has been removed from the Safe Browsing WebUI handler (SafeBrowsingUIHandler), simplifying the interface for the chrome://safe-browsing page. (1dc740c)
  • Safe Browsing's client-side detection logic has been refined. It now skips preclassification checks for error documents to improve metrics, and new histograms have been added to monitor the performance, errors, and quota usage of server-side intelligent scans. (137a3f7) (6f1b149)
  • A potential memory safety issue was resolved in the Windows USB device handler (usb_device_handle_win.cc) by replacing an UNSAFE_TODO(memset(...)) call with modern C++ zero-initialization, hardening the code. (d5d92a2)

Extensions

  • A new feature flag, kContentVerifierCacheIncludesExtensionRoot, has been introduced to begin experimenting with a fix for extension corruption. This change, currently disabled by default, aims to prevent hash mismatches by including the extension's root path in the content verifier's cache key. (dd0f836) (621959d)

Browser UI & Features

  • The experimental Vertical Tabs feature received several UI refinements, including adjusted margins for tabs in the collapsed state and a new opacity gradient on the scroll view to visually indicate when content is hidden. (be19c99) (39012f4)
  • The experimental 'Contextual Tasks' feature continues to be developed, with changes to disable its WebUI when the user is ineligible, styling fixes, and improved state management for the submit button during uploads. (0f11cf1) (ee83911) (a9edee9)
  • A minor CSS fix was applied to the New Tab Page to correct the background of action chip rows when a theme image is present. (1e2fbaf)
  • A code quality improvement was made to the Media Router's network discovery logic on Windows, replacing a memcmp call with a safer C++ equivalent for comparing GUIDs. (a443377)

Infrastructure

  • To improve diagnostics, the updater's crash client will now log uploaded crash report IDs to updater.log. This makes the IDs accessible to tools like chrome://support-tool. (78b3b6d)

2026-01-02

Open Standalone Page

Chromium Digest: 2026-01-02

Overview

This digest covers 100 commits from the Chromium repository. After filtering for changes relevant to browser embedders on desktop platforms (Windows/macOS) and focusing on APIs, extensions, networking, security, and UI, this report highlights the most significant updates. Several major breaking changes to public APIs in the UI framework, Safe Browsing, and authentication services were identified.

UI & Aura Framework

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING: The aura::WindowEventDispatcherObserver interface has been removed, along with its registration methods on aura::Env (AddWindowEventDispatcherObserver and RemoveWindowEventDispatcherObserver). This was a public API for observing all window event dispatchers. Embedders relying on this interface for event monitoring will need to migrate to ui::PlatformEventObserver. (47e1cd3)

Security & Authentication

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING: The public virtual methods on EnclaveManagerInterface, a KeyedService for WebAuthn, have been renamed to follow the PascalCase convention. Specifically, is_registered(), is_loaded(), and is_ready() are now IsRegistered(), IsLoaded(), and IsReady(). Any external code subclassing this interface or calling these methods directly will fail to compile. (36fb252)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING: The safe_browsing::PingManager no longer supports hit reports. The public method ReportSafeBrowsingHit and the associated HitReport struct have been removed. Embedders using this mechanism to report when a Safe Browsing warning was shown will need to remove these calls. (bb63549)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING: A new pure virtual method, AsWeakPtr(), has been added to the affiliations::AffiliationService public interface. This service is used by the Password Manager to group credentials. Any external project that provides its own implementation of AffiliationService will need to implement this new method to avoid compilation errors. (2b5dedb)

Privacy

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING: The signature for the public function privacy_sandbox::MaybeSetRollbackPrefsModeB has been changed. The syncer::SyncService* parameter was removed, simplifying the function to MaybeSetRollbackPrefsModeB(PrefService* prefs). This change, part of the 3rd-Party Cookie Deprecation rollback, will break any code directly calling this function. (1bcd25c)

Extensions

  • Promise support has been enabled for the runtime.onMessageExternal event. This allows extension listeners to return a Promise for an asynchronous response, modernizing the API. Existing callback-based sendResponse functionality remains, so this is a non-breaking enhancement. (3061069)
  • Internal refactoring updated error handling in UnpackedInstaller and file_util to use std::u16string instead of std::string, avoiding unnecessary string conversions. This does not affect public extension APIs. (5980162) (7c4ffb7)

Networking

  • A bug has been fixed in Local Network Access (LNA) to allow fetch() calls within shared workers in Chrome Apps to correctly access private network resources. This restores expected functionality for app developers. (f061a97)

2026-01-01

Open Standalone Page

Chromium Digest: 2026-01-01

Overview

This digest covers 2 commits. The focus is on changes impacting browser functionality, APIs, and testing utilities, while excluding internal rendering engine and OS-specific modifications. This cycle contains no major breaking changes.

Testing & Infrastructure

  • The unit tests for SessionStorageAreaImpl and StorageAreaImpl have been refactored to remove direct dependencies on LevelDB. These changes update tests to use the generic DomStorageDatabase interface and introduce a FakeCommitter for test setups, allowing the tests to run against multiple database backends like LevelDB and SQLite. This is an internal testing improvement with no impact on production APIs. (cc05929) (e4b9930)

2025-12-31

Open Standalone Page

Chromium Digest: 2025-12-31

Overview

This digest covers 65 commits from (7361613)" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="text-sky-500 hover:text-sky-300 font-mono">((7361613)) to (7319877)" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="text-sky-500 hover:text-sky-300 font-mono">((7319877)). After filtering for changes relevant to Windows and macOS embedders, this report summarizes 39 commits, highlighting significant updates in Extensions, Signin, UI, and core APIs, including three major breaking changes.

Extensions

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING: The ExtensionFunctionDispatcher::Delegate public interface has been significantly altered. The virtual methods GetAssociatedWebContents() and GetVisibleWebContents() have been removed. Furthermore, ExtensionWebContentsObserver no longer inherits from this delegate. Embedders implementing this delegate or relying on the inheritance structure must update their code. (9885010) (dc15d34)
  • The downloads API has been refactored to use ExtensionFunction::GetSenderWebContents() instead of the now-removed GetVisibleWebContents() from the dispatcher delegate. This standardizes how the function retrieves the associated web contents. (0d1a902)
  • Two feature flags related to extension telemetry have been removed as the features are now stable and enabled by default: ExtensionTelemetryDeclarativeNetRequestActionSignal and ExtensionTelemetryFileDataForCommandLineExtensions. (0365765) (8f22844)

Signin and Identity

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING: The public method can_use_chrome_ip_protection() has been removed from the AccountCapabilities class located in components/signin/public/identity_manager. The commit message indicates it was unused, but any embedder querying this capability will encounter a build failure. (47c3d62)
  • The sign-in promo displayed on the history page (history_sync_promo) now has an updated cooldown behavior. If dismissed, it will reappear after a 1-week cooldown; if not interacted with, it is shown up to 5 times without a cooldown. (dbbf629)

APIs

  • The TranslationAPI feature flag has been removed, enabling the API by default. This makes the window.chrome.translation API consistently available. (fdaa2fc)

Security

  • The logic for throttling automatic password changes has been updated. Throttling will now also occur when a user dismisses the offer to change a password, in addition to cancellation or failure. (9e0ddd9)
  • The deprecated SameParty cookie attribute, which was ignored by the parser, has been removed from several unit tests related to sign-in and OAuth. (2108e6e)

UI & UX

  • Multiple updates have been made to the New Tab Page, including UI tweaks for privacy settings, updated chip titles, and suggestion content. (54d9b5c) (372721b) (a6b7d5a)
  • A series of changes were made to the experimental Contextual Tasks feature, including UI fixes for the onboarding tooltip, disabling the Lens button when the overlay is active, and bug fixes. (55d8386) (e835636) (e0c9e13) (27396a2) (f5a84a7)
  • A change to synchronize screenshots for back-forward transitions was reverted due to test failures. This may affect the smoothness or reliability of the transition animation. (b800d0d)

Networking

Networking & Performance

  • On Windows, the google-chrome:// and chromium:// custom URI schemes will now be registered with the OS. This may affect how custom protocol handlers are resolved. (17d026d)
  • A new trigger has been added to initiate prewarming of network resources when a user interacts with the omnibox. This behavior is controlled by the PrewarmOnOmniboxInteraction feature flag. (ca37757)
  • The sampler for ExhaustedIntervalsPerThirtySeconds (related to memory pressure) has been moved to a dedicated thread. This ensures it can run even when the main thread is stalled, improving measurement accuracy. (c37aedf)

Developer Experience & Infrastructure

  • A large-scale refactoring has replaced numerous usages of base::to_underlying with the standard C++23 std::to_underlying, modernizing the codebase. (ad18a4c) (19cd5a1) (6f7da9c)
  • The LanguageDetectionAPI feature flag has been removed, enabling the functionality by default. (b513405)
  • As part of an ongoing refactoring, the BinaryUploadService has been moved from chrome/browser to the components directory and placed within the enterprise_connectors namespace. (7abbd96) (6e6df93)

Security

  • To prevent crashes from excessive memory allocation, a 256MB size limit has been imposed when reading text, HTML, and PNG data from the Windows clipboard. (600a5b3)
  • The certificate verification process has been updated to support Merkle Tree-based certificate verification. (43e6793)
  • For Device Bound Session Credentials (DBSC), garbage collection is now delayed by two minutes after session loading to improve startup performance. (2e87504)
  • The feature to redact passwords in screenshots submitted with user feedback has been enabled by default. (e4d33e7)
  • The Safe Browsing file analyzer will now use the RAR obfuscated analyzer for RAR files determined to be obfuscated. (c7121fb)

Networking

  • To improve load balancing, IP addresses for DNS-over-HTTPS (DoH) bootstrap lookups are now randomized. (6524fa3)

Extensions

  • A new extension disable reason, DISABLE_BLOCKED_BY_CLOUD_POLICY_CHECK, has been added to support the ExtensionInstallCloudPolicyChecksEnabled policy. (40752ba)
  • The developerPrivate API implementation has been simplified by merging platform-specific DeveloperPrivateFunctions classes into a single class. (cbbbe3a)

Policy & Enterprise

  • The chrome://policy page will now display a "Restart required" status for policies that have been changed but do not support dynamic refresh. (9435502)
  • A new SearchContentSharingPolicyHandler has been added to facilitate the deprecation of several older Lens-related policies. (818b9a9)
  • Warning logs will now be emitted before a user profile is forcibly deleted due to enterprise policy conflicts, providing more visibility for administrators. (26534df)

Testing

  • The EmbeddedTestServer can now be configured with a specific certificate and private key, aiding tests for features like Merkle Tree Certificates. (1f0b188)

  • The LoadErrorReporter has been moved from //chrome to //extensions and now provides an interface for embedders to implement their own UI for showing extension load error dialogs. (a6ad1ac)

Security & Privacy

  • A recent regression has been fixed where enterprise-policy-controlled Default Search Engine (DSE) settings were incorrectly flagged as "tampered with", causing the DSE to be reset on every startup for managed devices. (8af36e0)
  • The HttpsOnlyMode policy has been updated to be explicitly recommendable, making it visible on the enterprise policy page and clarifying its behavior for non-mandatory enterprise configurations. (2bea263)
  • Client-Side Detection (CSD) for phishing will no longer send a ping upon simple detection of a credit card form. It now waits for a user interaction event, reducing lower-value network pings. (f38ebf3) (194bc41)
  • A fix was implemented in the installer to correctly open the cookie database when the user's profile path contains a # character, which was previously misinterpreted as a URI fragment. (9c964f5)

  • Development continues on the experimental Vertical Tabs feature, with changes to add basic tab interaction logic, fix painting issues, and refactor the tab anchor view interface. (39781ba) (81d77a2) (53de04f)

  • For the experimental Gemini integration, a new setting (kGlicDaisyChainNewTabs) allows the sidebar to remain open when new tabs are created. A safe accessor, GlicUI::From(WebContents*), was also added to prevent crashes. (59393e9) (027667c)
  • A fix was implemented for the Task Manager on Windows, allowing it to be closed with the Alt+F4 shortcut. (cf75fa4)

Core Services & Infrastructure

  • On Windows, userenv.dll is now delay-loaded to improve process startup performance by reducing the number of DLLs loaded at launch. (36361cc)
  • To support the modern CADisplayLink framework for VSync on macOS, a new dedicated VSyncThread has been added to the browser process, improving performance and avoiding extra tasks on the main thread. (75e50bd)
  • The VSync thread logic on Windows has been improved to correctly source IDXGIOutputs from all available graphics adapters, fixing a performance issue on multi-GPU systems. (6187f20)
  • The shutdown process for SessionStorageImpl is now synchronous and handled in its destructor, simplifying the code and preventing shutdown-blocking tasks from being scheduled. (cec69b7)

Networking

  • The Proxy Resolution Service has been optimized to own and reuse pending DNS resolution requests. This reduces create/cancel spam on the HostResolver and allows DNS lookups to complete even if the original requestor is destroyed. (45937c4)

Build System

The GpuChannelManager constructor signature was changed to accept a GpuPersistentCacheCollection, and an overload of DawnCachingInterfaceFactory::CreateInstance was removed. This affects embedders integrating with Dawn for GPU operations. (4cc3088)

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING BREAKING: Public FIDO headers have been moved from device/fido/ to device/fido/public/ without providing forwarding headers. Downstream projects that include the old header paths will experience build failures. (0615b88)

  • A bug was fixed where HTTP 425 (Too Early) responses were incorrectly retried for all idempotent requests. The fix ensures retries only happen when TLS early data was actually sent. (1a07b4e)

Browser UI & Features

  • A bug causing the Omnibox popup to appear in the wrong position after moving a browser window has been fixed by synchronizing its bounds before showing. (c067a28)
  • On macOS, a window focus issue that occurred when switching windows via notification clicks has been resolved by deferring the processing of windowDidResignKey events. (c9401b7)

Testing & Infrastructure

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The public field std::string hosted_domain has been removed from the core AccountInfo struct. Code must be updated to use the new GetHostedDomain() accessor method. This impacts any embedder code that interacts with user account information. (d85bfc8) (7122320) (fad7a0a)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The callback signature for SimpleURLLoader::DownloadToStringOfUnboundedSizeUntilCrashAndDie has been changed. The callback now receives a std::optional instead of a std::unique_ptr, requiring updates for consumers of this networking utility. (64859a9)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The public virtual method ScreenWin::GetSystemScaleFactor has been removed from ui/display/win/screen_win.h. This is a public API removal from a core UI class used by Windows embedders to query display properties. (23d1767)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The base::MemoryPressureListener API has a significant behavioral change. It will now dispatch a notification when memory pressure returns to MEMORY_PRESSURE_LEVEL_NONE. Embedders with custom listeners must update their code to handle this new notification type to avoid unexpected behavior. (d139d7a)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The IdentifiabilityMetricBuilder class and its public header (third_party/blink/public/common/privacy_budget/identifiability_metric_builder.h) have been completely removed. Any project using this privacy budget metrics infrastructure will fail to build. (7f86b6c)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The Chrome DevTools Protocol (CDP) has been modified, moving the StyleSheetId type from the CSS domain to the DOM domain. CDP clients that reference CSS.StyleSheetId must be updated to use DOM.StyleSheetId. (23a0a9f)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The signature of OneTimeTokenService::RequestOneTimeToken has been changed. The callback now uses base::expected instead of std::variant, requiring embedders to update their callback handling logic. (60dd78d)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The constructor signature for variations::VariationsIdsProvider has been changed. It now requires a std::unique_ptr instead of a TimeSource callback, breaking any code that constructs this class directly. (ee8def4)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The SyncServiceImplHarness testing utility has removed the public methods EnableSyncForType() and DisableSyncForType(). Downstream projects using this test harness for sync integration tests must update to use EnableSelectableType() and DisableSelectableType() instead. (a745a2c)

Security & Identity

  • The getDisplayMedia screen picker UI now prevents capturing audio from Chromium's own application windows. The audio sharing toggle will be disabled when a Chromium window is selected, enhancing privacy and preventing audio feedback loops. (3eff999)
  • Local Network Access (LNA) permission prompts will now be shown earlier for specific hostnames like IP literals and .local domains, which may affect applications relying on local network resources. (20bad26)
  • Support for encrypted tracked preferences has been enabled on managed Windows devices, controlled by a new feature flag. (eb38a21)
  • The PasskeyUnlockManager keyed service is now initialized eagerly with the BrowserContext, altering its startup timing. (757e5ee)
  • The internal passwordsPrivate extension API has been migrated to use Mojo interfaces. (f63e55a) (de25d79) (e58cb3f) (0bc2654)

Browser & UI

  • The SidePanelAnimationCoordinator::Observer API experienced significant churn. A breaking change to the observer interface was introduced and then reverted on the same day due to test failures. Embedders using this API should be aware of its instability. (cd25554) (52be89a)
  • The Tab Group Editor bubble has been enhanced to include actions for focusing or unfocusing a tab group, integrating it with the Group Focus feature. (2c6c0b8)
  • A new bubble for managing V8 optimizations can now be shown from an omnibox icon. (dda5187)
  • The logic for the web app intent picker has been refined to reduce user confusion. PWAs will no longer be shown in the picker if the current URL is in their 'extended scope' but other apps match it in their primary scope. (2f9e34a)
  • A new bubble view for saving walletable transit tickets has been implemented, and its consent prompt now uses a strike database to avoid repeatedly showing it to users. (a808951) (8c43613)
  • Foundational work for vertical tabs was completed by refactoring tab context menu logic into a new TabContextMenuController. (fc89d1c)

APIs & Extensions

  • A new Chrome DevTools Protocol (CDP) command, Target.getDevToolsTarget, has been introduced, allowing automation clients to retrieve the targetId of a DevTools window that is inspecting another target. (47ac877)
  • The remote debugging server can now automatically find and use an available port if the default (9222) is occupied. The server address is now displayed on chrome://inspect and can be queried via the new public getter DevToolsAgentHost::GetRemoteDebuggingServerAddress(). (a4e85e3) (8a418d9) (6a4ce7b)
  • A new enterprise policy, StaticStorageQuotaEnabled, has been added to allow administrators to override the default storage quota estimation behavior. (4ff2cdf)
  • Uninstalls of extensions triggered by internal management policies will no longer be synced across devices, correcting a behavior that could propagate policy-based removals unintentionally. (603aa5d)
  • Feature flags for the DOM distiller (e.g., kReaderModeDistillInApp) have been moved to a new component. This is a breaking change for embedders using component builds, as it requires updating linker dependencies. (658a091)
  • The kPrivacySandboxNoticeFramework feature flag and its related code have been removed as the feature is now stale. (4a8c270)

Networking & Performance

  • The networking stack's code cache system was updated to use PersistentCache in renderers, controlled by a new feature flag. This includes a new method on the blink.mojom.CodeCacheHost interface. (aa3a0f3)
  • The HttpCache's internal mechanism for tracking 'no-store' directives was upgraded from SHA-1 to SHA-256 for improved security, gated by a feature flag. (76846c5)
  • Obsolete code and test references to the sec-ch-ua-reduced and sec-ch-ua-full User-Agent client hints have been removed. (3740418)
  • The internal logic for selecting a tab to discard for memory savings has been migrated from the legacy TabManager to the more modern PageDiscardingHelper. (0d54250)

Base & Infrastructure

  • A potential use-after-free in Mojo's PlatformChannelServer and NamedMojoEndpointConnectorWin on Windows was addressed, improving stability during shutdown. (f10be52) (fc1c94d)
  • A crash in PrefHashFilter has been fixed, which occurred when a preference type mismatch was encountered during revalidation. (1ed9c55)
  • Windows stack trace generation was improved to use base::StringPrintf instead of std::hex to prevent formatting issues in debug logs. (02b452c)
  • A new AudioProcessMlModelForwarder was introduced to forward machine learning model updates to the audio process, intended to improve features like echo cancellation. (606dc44)

Overview

This summary covers 627 commits on the main branch for November 21st, 2025, with 439 identified as relevant to developers working on Chromium-based projects. Breaking Changes

  • The logic for handling bookmark corruption has been improved. Instead of reassigning all node IDs, Chromium will now only reassign IDs involved in a collision, providing more stability for extensions that rely on bookmark IDs. (115ab85)

Extensions

  • The crx_file::id_util::GenerateId() API was updated to use std::span for improved type safety and performance. (a82a18f)

Networking

  • A race condition in the File System Access API was fixed by removing a redundant user activation check in the browser process for ChooseEntries. This fixes a bug where the file picker could fail to open. (faf426c)
  • As part of moving connection-allowlist enforcement to the network service, a unique network restriction ID is now added to the URLLoaderFactory for each frame. (63c9638) (e0ef2cf)
  • Scaffolding was added for a ProxyingURLLoaderFactory to intercept network requests, in preparation for an upcoming Okta SSO extension integration. (9fc6e9f)

Build & Testing

  • A clang+rust toolchain roll was relanded after a previous revert. (c9e8ad2)

The crypto::UnexportableKeyProvider interface was refactored, moving key deletion to a new StatefulUnexportableKeyProvider sub-interface. The callback for UnexportableKeyService::DeleteAllKeysSlowlyAsync was also changed. (ad79817) (0902192) (2ecb0b3)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The chrome.history API and related internal queries will now include "actor" visits by default. This is a significant behavioral change that will alter the results of history queries for extensions and internal UI components. (4fc6703)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The safe_browsing::SafeBrowsingSetting enum has been removed and merged into safe_browsing::SafeBrowsingState. The underlying integer values have changed, breaking any code that referenced the old enum or its values directly. (17c7873)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING In the DevTools Protocol, the specialized CSSFontPaletteValuesRule type has been removed. Integrations that inspect @font-palette-values rules must now use the more generic CSSAtRule type. (9ea312d)

Security & Crypto

  • Following a major refactoring, the new StatefulUnexportableKeyProvider interface gained methods to DeleteAllSigningKeysSlowly and asynchronously retrieve all keys for garbage collection. (39ac517) (bdc6606) (466a2d2)
  • The Windows updater service now requires DialUpdateService to succeed before a Mojo connection is established, hardening the update mechanism. (c299de9)
  • A new "Ask-before-HTTP" dialog, which prompts users before navigating from HTTPS to an insecure HTTP page, is now enabled by default. (93a5e10)

Extensions

  • A new feature flag, WebRequestPersistFilteredEvents, has been introduced to mitigate a race condition on startup. When enabled, it persists filtered webRequest event listeners in ExtensionPrefs, ensuring they are loaded before a service worker starts and preventing missed network requests. (2fdf5bd) (b604380)
  • The sidePanel.onClosed event is now officially exposed in the public extension API documentation. (b2ce95e)

Networking

  • The network stack now supports proxy override rules, which are evaluated before other proxy resolution settings, allowing for more granular control over traffic routing. (956f59c)
  • The SharedDictionaryCache, used for caching compression dictionaries for dcb and dcz content encodings, is now enabled by default to improve performance on subsequent resource loads. (5af54ff)

Developer Tools

  • The remote debugging server can now be launched in an "approval mode" via a feature flag. This mode requires new connections to be manually approved, likely through a future chrome://inspect UI enhancement. (cd88f7e)

Browser UI & Core

  • A new user-facing error will now be displayed when the bookmarks sync storage limit is exceeded, informing users that their bookmarks are no longer being synchronized. (82baf77)
  • The ui::ElementTracker now supports adding a custom event callback that filters by a specific element ID, enabling more targeted UI automation and testing scenarios. (7eddab5)
  • On Windows and other Aura platforms, the browser tooltip view is now explicitly parented to the browser widget. This ensures tooltips correctly follow the browser's theme (e.g., dark mode) instead of defaulting to the system theme. (934b1e1)
  • The history::HistoryBackendObserver and history::HistoryServiceObserver interfaces are now documented to clarify that OnURLsModified may be called for URLs that resulted in a 404 error. (e7674d3)

Chromium Digest: 2025-11-19

Overview

This summary covers 662 commits on the main branch from (29bb9f0) to (a96996f), with 451 commits identified as relevant to developers working on Chromium-based projects. The day saw a significant number of breaking changes to core APIs, including `persistent_cache`, `base::flat_tree`, and the `ExtensionsBrowserClient` interface, requiring action from embedders. Other notable updates include enhancements to the remote debugging protocol, the extensions Web Request API, and UI consistency improvements.

Breaking Changes

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The public extensions::ExtensionsBrowserClient interface has two new pure virtual methods: GetExtensionManagement() and GetExtensionActionRunner(). Embedders who implement this client must provide implementations for these new methods to compile. (bc9fccb)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The public API for the persistent_cache component has been refactored. The BackendParams class is removed, and methods like Backend::Initialize are gone. Embedders must adapt to the new BackendStorage and PendingBackend model for creating and sharing caches. (da81816)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING A public erase(iterator) overload has been removed from the core base::flat_tree container. Code relying on this specific overload will fail to compile. (3de1d9d)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The public blink::WebMemoryPressureListener API has been removed. Embedders must migrate to the base::MemoryPressureListener for handling memory pressure events. (c022244) (cf35b90)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The cookie deprecation label feature has been completely removed. This includes the removal of public methods cookie_deprecation_label() and mutable_cookie_deprecation_label() from net::URLRequestContext. (5fe1c84) (c095fc3)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The public Mojo interface for IndexedDB (indexeddb.mojom) has been changed. The bits field in IDBValue is now a mojo_base.mojom.BigBuffer instead of array, breaking consumers of this interface. (21de555)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING In the Autofill component, the public static method autofill::FormData::DeepEqual has been renamed to RepresentIdenticalAndEquivalentDomElements. This will cause compile failures for embedders calling the old method. (c661889)

Core & APIs

  • The content::NavigationHandle methods SetRequestHeader and RemoveRequestHeader now accept std::string_view instead of const std::string&. This improves performance by reducing string copies. (7d6e063)
  • The callback signature for SimpleURLLoader::DownloadToStringOfUnboundedSizeUntilCrashAndDie was updated to use std::optional instead of std::unique_ptr, improving type safety and modernizing the API. (89d021f) (7ca6ae1)
  • The libc++ dependency was rolled forward, which notably includes the implementation of std::optional and marks more string functions as [[nodiscard]]. (afb865d)
  • A breaking change that moved logging::LoggingSettings out of the main base/logging.h header was reverted, restoring the previous API structure to fix build failures on Windows. (6201eb1)
  • Initialization for PerformanceScenarioObserverList is now a two-stage process. This allows observers to be registered earlier and better handles asynchronous setup in child processes. (69c8b39)

Extensions

  • The Web Request API has been enhanced to parse a SecurityInfo object from web requests, aligning with the W3C specification. This provides extensions with more detailed security information. (971ad9c)
  • The ExtensionsMenuViewModel has been refactored to use WebContentsObserver and TabListInterfaceObserver instead of TabStripModelObserver, simplifying the underlying implementation. (9a2025e)
  • The ExtensionInstallPolicyServiceFactory is now initialized during browser startup to ensure it is available when needed by other services. (cda0dba)

Security & Privacy

  • Feature flags related to Private Network Access (PNA) for workers and navigations have been removed (kPrivateNetworkAccessForWorkers, kPrivateNetworkAccessForNavigations). PNA checks are now enabled by default for workers. (a56961c)
  • Safe Browsing's OHTTP key fetch URL is now configurable via Finch and is saved to preferences to prevent key mismatches across browser restarts. (b66f900)
  • Utility functions have been added to device/fido for converting UserVerificationRequirement to and from strings, unifying this logic for WebAuthn implementations. (c1a9af9)

Browser UI & Features

  • On macOS, the application's ScopedKeepAlive is now created earlier during startup to prevent the browser from terminating prematurely, which could cause flaky startup behavior. (c665fee)
  • The navigation buttons (back, reload) in the Web App frame toolbar have been updated to use the same refreshed icons as the main browser UI, improving visual consistency. (4960502)
  • Several password-related UI bubbles have been updated to use views::BubbleAnchor instead of a raw views::View, improving code reuse and preparing for future WebUI compatibility. (c287474)
  • Fixes have been made to the side panel to correct z-ordering and ensure rounded corners are rendered properly. (6420f58) (3a44735)
  • Accessibility for the macOS system audio permission warning has been improved by changing the label's role to kAlert to prevent duplicate announcements by VoiceOver. (c8b04b3)

Developer Tools

  • A new "approval-mode" is being added to the remote debugging server. When enabled, new WebSocket connections will require user confirmation via a dialog and infobar, enhancing security. (3d94716) (0b9af34) (4f8dd59) (7c12e9d)
  • A new feature flag, DevToolsGenAi, has been added to control an upcoming AI-powered code generation feature within DevTools. (d62d9bf)

Testing & Build System

  • A new Python script, build/bench/run_action.py, has been added to benchmark the local build speed of individual files. This helps developers measure the performance impact of build configurations. (6faf918)
  • The build configuration for macOS was fixed to ensure the -MMD compile command correctly respects the system_headers_in_deps flag. (d804bfc)

Chromium Digest: 2025-11-18

On 2025-11-18, a total of 661 commits were made to the 'main' branch, with 476 analyzed as relevant to developers of Chromium-based projects. The day's changes span from commit (658806c) to (00fad10).

Breaking Changes

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The deprecated BodyAsStringCallbackDeprecated in SimpleURLLoader has been removed. Callbacks for DownloadToString now receive a std::optional instead of a std::unique_ptr, requiring updates for all callers. (1cb4175)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The extensions::Message struct has been converted to a class. Direct member access (e.g., message.data) must be replaced with accessor methods (e.g., message.data()). (6724f6a)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The SidePanelUI::Close() method signature has been updated to Close(absl::optional interaction_source, bool suppress_animations). The previous Close() method on SidePanelUIBase was removed, requiring call sites to be updated. (af3468f)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING In the extensions framework, Feature::AvailabilityResult has been converted to a strongly-typed enum class, requiring all usage sites to be updated for improved type safety. (7b88411)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The FedCM ShowAccountsDialog API has been refactored. The new_accounts parameter was removed; new accounts are now indicated by an account's display_priority field. This changes how the browser-side IdentityDialogController is invoked. (2b71c89)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The kSetLeakCheckRequestCriticality feature flag for Password Manager has been removed as the feature is now fully launched. Any tests or configurations relying on this flag must be updated. (0b78ff2)

Security

  • A new framework for on-disk cache encryption has been introduced. A Mojo interface network.mojom.CacheEncryptionProvider and a CacheEncryptionProviderImpl allow the network service to encrypt the disk cache using OS-level cryptographic keys. (354e930) (01a412d)
  • A use-after-free vulnerability in OverscrollController has been fixed. The fix adds a WeakPtr check to ensure the controller is still valid before executing the OnOverscrollComplete callback. (9831039)
  • An ObfuscatedFileReader class has been implemented as part of the enterprise obfuscation framework to securely read obfuscated files. (fb2eccb)
  • The automated password change feature now uses new helper classes (FormFillingHelper, TypingHelper) to better emulate user typing for each form field individually, improving reliability. (41ff94c) (52287e9)

Extensions

  • The internal infrastructure for reporting extension loading errors has been migrated from std::string to std::u16string to provide better support for non-ASCII characters in error messages. (a411f78)
  • Extension telemetry reports have been updated to redact information for privacy, now only including id, name, version, install_location, and is_from_store. (19358e5)
  • The ExternalLoader for extensions has been refactored into a separate build target to break a dependency cycle, simplifying the build graph for //chrome/browser/extensions. (b4886e9)
  • The implementation for the extension download open dialog has been moved from chrome/browser/download to chrome/browser/ui/extensions as it is only used by extensions. (47fa3a5)

UI & UX

  • A new infobar prioritization system, enabled by the kInfobarPrioritization flag, prevents high-priority infobars (e.g., security warnings) from being queued behind less critical ones. (9945c13)
  • A close button has been added to tabs in the vertical tab strip, initially visible only on the active tab. (09e79d9)
  • On macOS, the Picture-in-Picture screen capture coordinator is now a global singleton, fixing a bug where PiP windows were not correctly excluded from screen captures. (e184ba1)
  • A new WebUI page has been created for chrome://updater. The page is currently a stub and will be built out in future changes. (6d8a579)
  • The avatar toolbar button has a new UI state to indicate when passkeys are locked, improving user awareness. (8d6a422)
  • A number of Autofill-related UI bubbles have been refactored to use views::BubbleAnchor, an architectural improvement that enables better code reuse. (bfa4433)

Performance & Networking

  • The BrowserInterfaceBrokerImpl is now created lazily on RenderFrameHostImpl instances. This optimization, controlled by the kLazyBrowserInterfaceBroker feature flag, can save 50-100 KiB of memory per background tab at startup. (82396a0)
  • The components/persistent_cache has been updated to use an incremental BLOB API, allowing callers to check the size of a cached item without reading its entire content into memory. (87c9441)
  • A bug in the SQL-based disk cache on 32-bit systems that could cause an incorrect entry count during cache eviction due to an integer overflow has been fixed. (5fb338e)
  • On Windows, shared image encoding via Media Foundation is now disabled if the hardware encoder is on a different graphics adapter than the main one, preventing performance degradation. (0160151)

Core & Infrastructure

  • A new framework has been added to monitor for changes to the system's default browser on Windows. It provides an observable service that asynchronously watches the UserChoice registry key. (537f46f) (563947c)
  • The StartupLaunchManager has been moved from chrome/browser/background to its own directory, chrome/browser/startup, to better organize startup-related logic. (250b1a7)
  • The DICTIONARY sync data type is now correctly controlled by the history sync toggle instead of the settings sync toggle, ensuring consistent user-facing behavior. (b461bcb)
  • A new test utility, ScopedCreditCardAccessManagersObservation, has been added to simplify the testing of credit card autofill flows by observing all CreditCardAccessManager instances within a tab. (653bcfe)

Breaking Changes & Deprecations

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING As part of 'Project Bedrock', parts of the codebase are being migrated away from BrowserList and BrowserListObserver. Projects relying on this global list of browser instances will need to be updated as this refactoring continues. (08d979d) (20b7081)

(81c1f92) (1fdff46) (9ec1ad7) (d208977)

  • DevTools can now be opened directly to a specific panel via a URL parameter. For example, using panel="performance" will open the Performance panel directly. (096d042)
  • The "Actor" automation framework now dispatches a mousemove event before a click event to more closely simulate real user interaction in tests. (fe03c46)
  • An improvement to headless mode on macOS was reverted due to test failures, indicating ongoing work in this area. (a0e2946)

Base & Core Improvements

  • A new platform-agnostic helper, base::GetAvailablePhysicalMemory(), has been added to provide a consistent way to estimate available memory. (d42f011)
  • A new high-performance base::LazyStringBuilder class was introduced to build strings by retaining references to components, avoiding intermediate memory allocations. (6f3703c)
  • The codebase continues to be modernized for memory safety by replacing raw pointers and sizes with std::span in multiple areas, including bookmarks and tab state serialization. (132358c) (cdd3e5c) (4238934)
  • The Crashpad dependency was updated on Windows, fixing a potential nullptr reference and improving crash reporting stability. (2719922) (faabd5e)

2025-11-12

Open Standalone Page

Chromium Digest: 2025-11-12

Overview

This summary covers 426 relevant commits out of 610 total commits from the Chromium main branch on November 12, 2025. Key changes include the removal of the deprecated `NavigationHandle::SetCorsExemptRequestHeader()` API, ongoing migration away from `BrowserListObserver`, and continued development of AI features in the omnibox. First commit: (9fd20c1), Last commit: (2d035cb).

Breaking Changes

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The deprecated and unused API NavigationHandle::SetCorsExemptRequestHeader() has been removed. Downstream projects relying on this function will need to remove its usage. (9cc9245)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING As part of Project Bedrock, browser tests continue to be migrated away from the deprecated BrowserListObserver. Projects should use BrowserList::AddObserver and BrowserList::RemoveObserver instead. (038899c)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The internal diagnostics page chrome://audio has been removed from the browser. (d368131)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The unlaunched experimental "Partitioned Popins" feature has been removed, including its controller, permissions policies, HTTP headers, and IDL definitions. (1a2cbc1) (1ce0cb5) (1b14dc3) (8c2b7da) (c9d54f0)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The internal Autofill API AutofillDriver::ExtractForm() was refactored to ExtractFormWithField(), changing its signature to use a FieldGlobalId instead of a renderer-specific form ID. (83d041c)

Browser UI & Features

  • A Mojo interface for the AI Model (AIM) popup in the omnibox was added, facilitating communication between the browser and the WebUI. (65727d6) (d274bf2) (6ff1965)
  • The "Save" and "Cancel" buttons in the "Save PDF to Drive" dialog on Windows have been swapped to better align with platform conventions. (5ad18b8)
  • Picture-in-Picture windows can now be excluded from screen recordings on macOS via a new proxy for the screen capturer. (2abe340)

Extensions

  • Additional crash keys have been added to help diagnose a rare issue where an extension's site access toggle is off but its access level is incorrectly set to "On all sites". (7a55650)

Security

  • Fixed a bug on Windows where Chrome could hold a critical policy section indefinitely, ensuring the section is always exited to prevent potential deadlocks. (1046b03)
  • On macOS, the key deletion logic for Device Bound Session Credentials (DBSC) was updated to use an application tag for more precise key identification. (60f88a6)

Developer Tools

  • DevTools can now collect font-related @rules for pseudo-elements like ::first-letter, allowing for more accurate style inspection. (0f24f72)

Testing & Infrastructure

  • A large number of browser tests were updated to use valid certificates configured on the test server, removing the need for the --ignore-certificate-errors command-line switch and improving test correctness. (64d5855) (7b97b4a)
  • Introduced ProcessPerformanceScenarioObserverList to centralize the management of performance scenario observers, unblocking future optimizations. (c72888f)
  • The third-party abseil-cpp library has been rolled to a newer version. (6d6c83c)

2025-11-11

Open Standalone Page

Chromium Digest: 2025-11-11

Overview

On 2025-11-11, the Chromium main branch saw 576 commits, with 406 considered relevant for browser developers. This day's changes include several significant API and architectural updates, such as the removal of the Partitioned Popins feature, performance boosts to networking key structures, and continued work under Project Bedrock to decouple core components. First commit: 96bff48d29d12cab7f5d380a5cc5a35a65e9a750, Last commit: 089db6cd18f69288a49ebb1fc988c0d1d2976c19.

Architecture & APIs

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING As part of the 'Project Bedrock' initiative, several services including session_service and idle_service were migrated away from observing BrowserList. This architectural change reduces dependencies on the global Browser object and may require updates for downstream code that interacts directly with these components. (0e5b5d1) (1f82c9e) (643ce22)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The Partitioned Popins feature, which was in a DevTrial, is being removed. This initial step removes the enabling IPC call, effectively disabling the feature globally. (154f95a)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING In the Autofill component, the function ExtractForm() has been renamed to ExtractFormWithField() to better clarify its purpose. Code calling the old function will need to be updated. (5063b6a)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The feature flag and kill switch for a previously launched postMessage optimization have been removed, finalizing the feature's integration. (3e8c3dd)
  • A new reason, kBackgrounded, has been added to the SidePanelHideReason enum. This helps differentiate when a side panel is hidden due to a tab switch versus other user actions. (074a009)

Performance & Networking

  • The core networking classes IsolationInfo, NetworkIsolationKey, and NetworkAnonymizationKey were refactored to use ref-counted data members. This makes them significantly cheaper to copy, reducing overhead in network requests. (d9614f9)
  • A race condition in the GPU process cache was fixed by moving the PersistentCache to its own dedicated 'GPUPersistentCache' directory, improving stability. (69c0a1a)

Browser UI

  • The Omnibox 'Answer in Omnibox' (AIM) and 'Composebox' features received several updates, including support for file drag-and-drop and new UI states for errors like file limits. (29a75ee) (589885e) (e3d64b2)
  • The HID device chooser on Windows has been improved to correctly find device product names. It now checks all available device info entries before falling back to a generic name, fixing issues where some devices appeared unnamed. (a34ca6d)
  • The state management for the omnibox popup (OmniboxPopupView) was refactored for better consistency and reliability. (937004d)

Testing

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The --ignore-certificate-errors flag has been removed from a large number of browser tests to improve security and reliability. Downstream projects may need to update their test environments to use a proper HTTPS test server. (55032fa) (8f56585) (ce0ad21) (59f6448) (798cbae) (56b1829)
  • A new command-line switch, --attempt-form-filling-tool-skips-ui, was added to allow the form-filling test tool to bypass the data selector UI, streamlining automated testing. (a352613)

2025-11-10

Open Standalone Page

Chromium Digest: 2025-11-10

Overview

A total of 482 commits were made to the 'main' branch. After filtering, 322 relevant commits were analyzed. The day's changes span from commit (9231b16) to (a37032d).

Breaking Changes

  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING As part of the "Project Bedrock" initiative to decouple browser components, the global BrowserListObserver is being replaced. New interfaces, ProfileBrowserCollection and BrowserCollectionObserver, have been introduced to provide an observable collection of browser windows on a per-profile basis. Code that previously relied on observing the global list of browsers will need to migrate to this new, more structured API. (886bfce) (9fbc578) (2577a13)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING The OnUpdateError method has been removed from the update_client::CrxInstaller interface in components/update_client/update_client.h. This method was found to be uncalled across the codebase, and its removal cleans up the component installer API. External projects implementing this interface will need to remove the method override. (d279473)
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING Delegate methods in TlsStreamAttempt::Delegate have been renamed for clarity. WaitForServiceEndpointReady() is now WaitForTlsHandshakeReady(), and GetServiceEndpoint() is now GetServiceEndpointForTlsHandshake(). Projects using these net component APIs will need to update their method calls. (38579c3)

Security

  • The Secure DNS (DNS-over-HTTPS) feature in "Automatic" mode now supports a fallback to well-known DoH providers. A new preference, kDnsOverHttpsAutomaticModeFallbackToDoh, allows Chromium to use a hardcoded list of providers (e.g., Google DNS) if upgrading the system's DNS provider fails, preventing a fallback to insecure DNS. As part of this work, the non-functional AlekBergNl provider was also removed from the list. (76cab8c) (984ddf8) (c5225eb)
  • Two new enterprise policies, GeolocationAllowedForUrls and GeolocationBlockedForUrls, have been introduced. These policies give administrators fine-grained control to allow or block geolocation access for specific URL patterns, complementing the existing DefaultGeolocationSetting policy. (4f84a5b)

Networking

  • Navigations that are in progress when a tab is closed will now correctly report a network error of net::ERR_ABORTED. This change improves the accuracy of navigation lifecycle events and resolves race conditions for observers of NavigationHandle, particularly for external protocol navigations. (01c95b3)

Extensions

  • A large-scale refactoring has renamed ToolbarActionViewController to ToolbarActionViewModel throughout the extensions UI codebase. This change better reflects the Model-View-ViewModel (MVVM) architecture and impacts numerous files related to the toolbar and extension action presentation. (f1115cf) (4f2f7ae) (b9f3429)

UI/UX

  • The legacy UI controls for video Picture-in-Picture have been completely removed, along with the associated feature flag kVideoPictureInPictureControlsUpdate2024. This finalizes the transition to the updated 2024 UI and simplifies the overlay implementation in chrome/browser/ui/views/overlay/. (272e694)
  • The Bookmarks Bar folder menu has been enhanced with 'Open all' and 'Open all in new tab group' buttons, providing functionality previously only available in the context menu. (0e87e22)
  • A new API has been added to the Glic service (chrome/browser/glic/host/glic.mojom) that allows it to open the Password Manager settings page programmatically. (da2ce6c)

Bug Fixes

  • Fixed a crash on macOS that could occur when entering immersive fullscreen mode while a popover (NSPopover) was visible. The workaround in components/remote_cocoa/app_shim/immersive_mode_controller_cocoa.mm proactively closes open popovers before the transition. (b68f959)
  • Corrected a race condition that could leave an empty managed app list on chrome://management. The UI handler now ensures that WebAppPolicyManager is fully initialized before displaying its data. (1a0886f)

Infrastructure

  • The internal plugin loading mechanism in content/browser/plugin_list.cc has been significantly simplified. Several internal methods were consolidated, and the LoadingState enum was replaced with a boolean, reducing complexity in this legacy component. (269b749) (1b93c96) (293add8)

2025-11-09

Open Standalone Page

Chromium Digest: 2025-11-09

Overview

A total of 107 commits were made to the 'main' branch. After filtering for changes relevant to projects built on Chromium, 9 commits were analyzed. The day's changes span from commit (96c4358) to (cfa4cb1).

Security

  • Introduces a "Site Familiarity" check that can defer navigation to determine if a site is new to the user. This mechanism, which checks browsing history and a high-confidence allowlist, is used to decide whether to enable V8 optimizations. This change primarily affects process selection logic within chrome/browser/site_protection. (9beb380)
  • The logic for enabling image sharing (IsShareImageEnabledForProfile) in chrome/browser/glic/public/glic_enabling.cc now includes a check for managed accounts, enhancing policy enforcement for enterprise users. (903dd22)

UI/UX

  • A null-check was added for the expandedSearchboxShowVoiceSearch flag in the omnibox component (cr_components/searchbox/searchbox.ts), preventing a potential browser crash. (f519a52)

Developer Tools

  • A new command-line switch, --webnn-ort-ep-device, has been added to allow developers to force the WebNN service to use a specific ONNX Runtime execution provider (e.g., a particular GPU), which is useful for testing and debugging. (98e6bd5)
  • The UI compositor's debugging utilities (ui/compositor/debug_utils.cc) can now print the background color of a layer when dumping the layer tree, providing more context for developers debugging UI rendering. (905c682)

Infrastructure

  • The Local Storage implementation now uses a dedicated WriteMetadata() method within LocalStorageLevelDB to handle writing metadata for last accessed and modified times. This refactoring improves the clarity and maintainability of the DOM Storage service. (64b770d)
  • A large-scale cleanup removed unnecessary includes of base/files/file_util.h across the codebase, including in core files like base/base_paths_mac.mm and base/cpu.cc. (502b6c6)

Bug Fixes

  • A null pointer access in RendererBlinkPlatformImpl has been fixed, resolving a crash that occurred when running in single-process mode (--single-process) due to a missing RendererMemoryCoordinatorPolicy. (7b5a317)

Testing

  • A new helper method, ButtonTestApi::NotifyMouseClick, was added to the views test framework. This simplifies UI tests by allowing developers to trigger a button click without manually constructing a MouseEvent. (0db0398)
